subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China, the bottom left component is {{l|mul|朩}}.
* In Taiwan, the bottom left component is {{l|mul|𣎳}}, but is only used as a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant form}} of <big>{{l|mul|剎}}</big>.
* In Japanese {{w|kanji}} and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the bottom left component is {{l|mul|木}}, which is the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=18|rad=刀|as=06|sn=8|four=42900|canj=KDLN,XKDLN|ids=⿰⿱㐅朩刂(G),⿰⿱㐅𣎳刂(T),⿰⿱㐅木刂(JK)}} <!-- Not using ⿰杀刂 as it contains only two different forms for G and T. Using three different ids instead -->

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[䓭]], [[𠝨]], [[𤟆]]}} ''(Only for mainland China {{w|zh:規範漢字|character forms}}. Taiwan {{w|zh:國字標準字體|character forms}} contain {{l|mul|剎}} instead)''
* {{l|mul|[[𥓑]], [[𭈗]], [[𮢎]], [[𥤔]]}}

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[剎]]}} (U+524E) ''(Preferred form for {{w|traditional Chinese}} used in Taiwan and Hong Kong, contains {{l|mul|朮}})''
